member.summary: Converts bytes of an array to an 32bit unsigned Integer, big endian.
member.param: Starting index. The array needs 3 more elements.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.ArrayExtensions.MakeDwordBigEndian(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts bytes of an array to an 32bit unsigned Integer, big endian.
member.param: Starting index. The array needs 3 more elements.

member.summary: Converts bytes of an array to an 32bit unsigned Integer, small endian.

member.summary: Converts bytes of an array to an unsigned short, small endian.

member.summary: Converts bytes of an array to an unsigned short, big endian.

member.summary: Converts bytes of an array to an unsigned short, big endian. If the array is not long enough, it returns 0.

member.summary: Gets the size of the packet header.

member.summary: Gets the size of the packet header.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.ArrayExtensions.GetPacketHeaderSize(System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the size of the packet header.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.ArrayExtensions.GetPacketType(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Gets the type of the packet. This only works when the packet type is not encrypted.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.ArrayExtensions.GetPacketSubType(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Gets the sub type of the packet. This only works when the packet type is not encrypted.
member.returns: The sub type of the packet.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.ArrayExtensions.GetPacketSize(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Gets the size of a packet from its header. C1 and C3 packets have a maximum length of 255, and the length defined in the second byte. C2 and C4 packets have a maximum length of 65535, and the length defined in the second and third byte.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.ArrayExtensions.GetPacketSize(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Gets the size of a packet from its header. C1 and C3 packets have a maximum length of 255, and the length defined in the second byte. C2 and C4 packets have a maximum length of 65535, and the length defined in the second and third byte.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.ArrayExtensions.SetPacketSize(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Sets the size of the byte array as packet length in the corresponding indexes of the byte array.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.InvalidPacketHeaderException
member.summary: An exception which occurs when a packet header is invalid.
member.remarks: This can be the case when: * The first byte of the packet is not one of 0xC1, 0xC2, 0xC3, 0xC4. * The length is defined as 0.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.InvalidPacketHeaderException._message
member.summary: The message, if built yet.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.InvalidPacketHeaderException.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Buffers.ReadOnlySequence{System.Byte},System.SequencePosition)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Content of the buffer when the header was read. With this information you can e.g. find out if a previous packet was malformed.
The position of the in the .

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.InvalidPacketHeaderException.Header
member.summary: Gets the header which is invalid.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.InvalidPacketHeaderException.BufferContent
member.summary: Gets the content of the buffer when the header was read. With this information you can e.g. find out if a previous packet was malformed.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.InvalidPacketHeaderException.Position
member.summary: Gets the position of the in the .

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.InvalidPacketHeaderException.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that describes the current exception.

member.summary: Defines how the own IP should be resolved and reported to the game client.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.IpResolverType.Auto
member.summary: The IP is detected automatically by considering the environment.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.IpResolverType.Public
member.summary: The IP is detected by asking an external service. As a result, we resolve to the public IP.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.IpResolverType.Local
member.summary: The IP is detected by asking the DNS about the IP of the own host name.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.IpResolverType.Loopback
member.summary: The IP is resolved as '127.127.127.127'.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.IpResolverType.Custom
member.summary: The IP or a host name can be set manually.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PacketPipeReaderBase
member.summary: Base class for all classes which read mu online data packets from a .
member.remarks: Things to consider here: * Do not call FlushAsync if the reader can't start until FlushAsync finishes, as that may cause a deadlock. * Ensure that only one context "owns" a PipeReader or PipeWriter or accesses them. These types are not thread-safe.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PacketPipeReaderBase.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the from which the packets can be read from at .

member.summary: Reads the mu online packet.
member.returns: , if the flush was successful or not required., if the pipe reader is completed and no longer reading data.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PacketPipeReaderBase.OnCompleteAsync(System.Exception)
member.summary: Called when the completed.
member.param: The exception, if any occurred; Otherwise, null.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PacketPipeReaderBase.ReadSourceAsync
member.summary: Reads from the until it's completed or cancelled.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PacketPipeReaderBase.TryFlushWriterAsync(System.IO.Pipelines.PipeWriter)
member.summary: Tries to flush the writer.
member.returns: , if the flush was successful or not required., if the pipe reader is completed and no longer reading data.

member.summary: Default server implementation of a which decrypts incoming data packets. It decrypts with the "simple modulus" algorithm first, and then with the 32 byte XOR-key.

member.summary: Default server implementation of a . It encrypts 0xC3 and 0xC4-packets with the "simple modulus" algorithm and writes through every other packet types.

member.summary: The korean client language. A plugin marked with this value is compatible only with the korean client.

member.summary: The thai client language. A plugin marked with this value is compatible only with the thai client.

member.summary: A strategy plugin interface for plugins which provide network packet encryptors and decryptors for a specific game client version.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PlugIns.INetworkEncryptionFactoryPlugIn.CreateDecryptor(System.IO.Pipelines.PipeReader,MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PlugIns.DataDirection)
member.summary: Creates a for the specified source.
member.param: The direction of the data flow.

members.member:
Creates a for the specified target.
The target. /// The direction of the data flow. The created encryptor.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PlugIns.OpenSourceClientNetworkEncryptionFactoryPlugIn
member.summary: A plugin which provides network encryptors and decryptors for the english open source game clients of season 6 episode 3, version 2.04d

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PlugIns.PreSeason6NetworkEncryptionFactoryPlugIn
member.summary: A plugin which provides network encryptors and decryptors for game clients before season 6.
member.remarks: The simple modulus keys were never changed, so the default keys of season 6 work here without changes. For the Xor32 key it's different. During season 6 on GMO, Webzen desperately changed them in a regular manner - sometimes every weekly maintenance. Needless to say, calculating the new key was a matter of seconds and provided no protection from skilled hackers at all.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PlugIns.PreSeason6NetworkEncryptionFactoryPlugIn.Xor32Key
member.summary: The xor32 key for all clients before season 6.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PlugIns.Season6Episode3NetworkEncryptionFactoryPlugIn
member.summary: A plugin which provides network encryptors and decryptors for english game clients of season 6 episode 3, version 1.04d.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PlugIns.Version075NetworkEncryptionFactoryPlugIn
member.summary: A plugin which provides network encryptors and decryptors for game clients of version 0.75 (server version 0.65).
member.remarks: This early and very old version doesn't seem to have xor 32 encryption yet. However, it uses simple modulus with some other keys.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PlugIns.Version075NetworkEncryptionFactoryPlugIn.ClientToServerKeys
member.summary: The simple modulus keys which are used to transfer data from client to server.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.PlugIns.Version075NetworkEncryptionFactoryPlugIn.ServerToClientKeys
member.summary: The simple modulus keys which are used to transfer data from server to client.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase
member.summary: The base class for the "simple modulus" encryption.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.BlockSizeXorKey
member.summary: The xor key which is used as to 'encrypt' the size of each block.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.BlockCheckSumXorKey
member.summary: The xor key which is used as to 'encrypt' the checksum of each encrypted block.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.#ctor(MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.Variant)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.Variant
member.summary: The variant of the algorithm.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.Variant.New
member.summary: The newer variant, where the unencrypted block size is 8 bytes, and encrypted is 11 bytes. Uses a counter.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.Variant.Old
member.summary: The older variant, where the unencrypted block size is 32 bytes and encrypted is 38 bytes. Doesn't use a counter.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.DecryptedBlockSize
member.summary: Gets the decrypted block size in bytes.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.EncryptedBlockSize
member.summary: Gets the encrypted block size in bytes. It's bigger than the decrypted size, because it contains the length of the actual data of the block and a checksum. Basically, you can calculate it by / 8 bits * 10 bits + 2 bytes.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.Counter
member.summary: Gets the counter.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.EncryptionResult
member.summary: Gets the ring buffer.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.HeaderBuffer
member.summary: Gets the header buffer of the currently read packet.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.Pipe
member.summary: Gets the pipe which is either the target (for the encryptor) or source (for the decryptor) for or of the encrypted packets.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.Reset
member.summary: Resets this instance.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.GetByteOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the byte offset in the encrypted block buffer based on the index of .
member.returns: The byte offset in the encrypted block buffer based on the index of .

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.GetBitOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the bit offset in the encrypted block buffer based on the index of .
member.returns: The bit offset in the encrypted block buffer based on the index of .

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.GetFirstBitMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the bit mask of the first byte (at the index of ) in the encrypted block buffer based on the index of .
member.returns: The the bit mask of the first byte (at the index of ) in the encrypted block buffer based on the index of .

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.GetRemainderBitMask(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the bit mask of the last byte (at the index of ) in the encrypted block buffer based on the index of , just for the last remainder of the encryption result value. The remainder is basically the first 2 bits, e.g. when the value is 0x2FFFF, the remainder is the 2 in front.
member.returns: The the bit mask of the first byte (at the index of ) in the encrypted block buffer based on the index of .

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.CopyDataIntoWriter(System.IO.Pipelines.PipeWriter,System.Buffers.ReadOnlySequence{System.Byte})
member.summary: Copies the data of the packet into the target writer, without flushing it yet.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusBase.GetContentSize(System.Span{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the size of the content.
member.param: if set to true it is decrypted. Encrypted packets additionally contain a counter.
member.returns: The size of the actual content.

member.summary: A decryptor which decrypts 0xC3 and 0xC4-packets with the "simple modulus" algorithm.

member.summary: The default server side decryption key. The corresponding encryption key is .

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusDecryptor.DefaultClientKey
member.summary: The default client side decryption key. The corresponding encryption key is .

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this decryptor instance accepts wrong block checksum, or throws an exception in this case.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusDecryptor.ReadPacketAsync(System.Buffers.ReadOnlySequence{System.Byte})
member.summary: Reads the mu online packet. Decrypts the packet and writes it into our pipe.
member.returns: , if the flush was successful or not required., if the pipe reader is completed and no longer reading data.

member.summary: Decrypts the block.
member.returns: The decrypted length of the block.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusDecryptor.DecodeFinal(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Decodes the last block which contains the checksum and the block size.
member.returns: The decrypted length of the block.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusDecryptor.GetMaximumDecryptedSize(System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Returns the maximum packet size of the packet in decrypted state. (The exact size needs to be decrypted first).
member.returns: The maximum packet size of the packet in decrypted state.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusEncryptor
member.summary: The standard encryptor (server-side) which encrypts 0xC3 and 0xC4-packets with the "simple modulus" algorithm.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusEncryptor.DefaultServerKey
member.summary: The default server side encryption key. The corresponding encryption key is .

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusEncryptor.DefaultClientKey
member.summary: The default client side decryption key. The corresponding encryption key is .

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusEncryptor.#ctor(System.IO.Pipelines.PipeWriter)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusEncryptor.#ctor(System.IO.Pipelines.PipeWriter,MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.SimpleModulusKeys)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusEncryptor.WriteResultToTarget(System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes the encryption result into the target span. It basically squeezes the result (4 bytes) into 2 bytes and 2 bits (=18 bits).

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.PipelinedSimpleModulusEncryptor.EncryptFinalBlockByte(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Encodes the final part of the block. It contains a checksum and the length of the block, which is needed for decryption.
member.param: The size of the block of decrypted data in bytes.
The output buffer to which the encrypted result will be written.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.SimpleModulusKeyGenerator
member.summary: A key generator which is able to generate a new pair of encryption/decryption keys.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.SimpleModulusKeyGenerator.GenerateKeysAsync
member.summary: Generates a new pair of keys.
member.returns: The generated pair of new keys.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.SimpleModulusKeyGenerator.FindOtherKey(System.UInt32[],System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Finds the other key when one of the decryption or encryption key is known. It works in both directions, when the encryption key is known and passed, the decryption key is returned and vice versa. This greatly demonstrates the "secureness" of this algorithm...

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.SimpleModulusKeyGenerator.KeyNotFoundException
member.summary: Exception which is thrown when a key is not found for the specified modulus and crypt keys.

member.summary: Gets the modulus key. These values are used for the modulus operation in the encryption/decryption process.

member.summary: Gets the xor key. These values are used for a xor operation in the encryption/decryption process.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.SimpleModulusKeys.EncryptKey
member.summary: Gets the encryption key. These values are used for the multiplication operation in the encryption process.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.SimpleModulusKeys.DecryptKey
member.summary: Gets the decrypt key. These values are used for the multiplication operation in the encryption process.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.SimpleModulusKeySerializer._encryptionKeys
member.summary: The xor encryption keys which used to "encrypt" and "decrypt" (XOR) the encryption keys to dat files. In newer versions, only the first 4 keys are in use. Older versions use a slightly different SimpleModulus algorithm with 16 keys.

member.name: F:MUnique.OpenMU.Network.SimpleModulus.SimpleModulusKeySerializer._headerOneKey
member.summary: The header for key files which contain just one side of the key (encryption or decryption).
